Description: Core-formed glass amphoriskos. Opaque white trails, translucent cobalt blue body, end-knob and handles. Broad rim-disc, bevelled inward, with tool-marks on upper and under surfaces; shortish, cylindrical neck, joining shoulder in gentle curve; elongated body, almost cylindrical until, near bottom, it tapers rapidly to a point. Large, tooled-on end-knob. Two thick handles with vertical grooving, dropped on at shoulder and drawn upward in curve to join upper part of neck. White trail dropped on upper side of rim-disc and wound spirally downward to just above bottom: at first, to shoulder, in simple spiral, then, on body, mainly in ten-and-a-half vertical panels of feather pattern, but with a group of five single strips of upright festoons on half of one side, and finally reverting, near bottom, to some simple spirals. Formed on a core; rim-disc, handles and base-knob drawn on and tooled; trails drawn on, marvered (except on lip) and combed. Original core-formed lip protrudes appreciably above inner edge of rim-disc.
Curator's comments: BM Glass Slade Catal. 1871, 8, no. 38, pl. a, fig. 15. Fossing 1940, 121f., fig. 96. Masterpieces 1968, 23, no. 17.
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (352)
Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (pl.49, p.45)
Condition: Intact. Milky weathering-film with much pitting and iridescence on one side, remainder largely retains pristine sheen, with stray patches of incipient weathering.
